intro: Bupleurum affine f. stribrnyi, commonly known as the stribrnyi form of the common valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often hairy. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers appear in clusters, and it is often found in moist meadows and woodland edges. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
